bill_title: provide for the awarding of matching grants to certain fire departments and to increase the fire insurance premium tax.

bill_versions.bill_text: FOR AN ACT ENTITLED, An Act to provide for the awarding of matching grants to certain fire departments and to increase the fire insurance premium tax. BE IT ENACTED BY THE LEGISLATURE OF THE STATE OF SOUTH DAKOTA: Section 1. That § 10-44-9 be amended to read as follows: 10-44-9. Every insurance company doing fire insurance business in this state, including a fire reciprocal insurer under chapter 58-34, shall pay in addition to the tax set forth in § 10-44-2 one-half of one percentum an amount equal to 0.75 percent of the gross premium receipts of such the company on all fire insurance business done in this state during the year next preceding as shown by its annual statement. Section 2. That § 10-44-9.1 be amended to read as follows: 10-44-9.1. On July fifteenth of each year the secretary of the Department of Revenue and Regulation shall determine the amount of fire insurance premium tax collected by the state under the provisions of §§ 10-44-2 and 10-44-9 for the previous calendar year. Thirty The first thirty thousand dollars of that amount is hereby annually appropriated to the Department of Public Safety for distribution to the South Dakota Firefighters Association, Incorporated, for training at state and district fire schools. Fifty The next five hundred thousand dollars of that amount shall be deposited annually in the fire department improvement fund established pursuant to section 3 of this Act. Fifty-five percent of the amount remaining shall be distributed according to § 10-44-9.4. All amounts determined for distribution pursuant to § 10-44-9.4 are hereby appropriated out of the general fund to the Department of Public Safety. Each fire department receiving funds from the fire insurance premium tax pursuant to § 10-44-9.4 shall continue to receive an amount not less than the amount received on July 1, 1989. Section 3. There is hereby created a special fund in the state treasury known as the fire department improvement fund. Money in the fund shall be used to provide matching fire department improvement grants to eligible fire departments and to administer the grant program as provided in section 4 of this Act. The fund consists of money deposited pursuant to section 2 of this Act, interest on investments, principal and interest on loans made from the fund, and moneys from all legal public and private sources, including legislative appropriations and federal grants. Money may be expended from the fund as determined in the general appropriations act according to Title 4. Section 4. The Department of Public Safety shall use money appropriated from the fire department improvement fund to provide matching fire department improvement grants to eligible fire departments beginning January 1, 2009, and no later than each May fifteenth, thereafter, subject to the following limitations: (1) To be eligible for a grant, a fire department shall be certified pursuant to § 10-44-9.2; (2) No grant may exceed ten thousand dollars; (3) The applicant shall match the grant on a dollar-for-dollar basis; (4) The grant may be used only for equipment purchases or capital expenditures necessary to provide fire protection services; and (5) No applicant may receive more than one grant per fiscal year. In awarding grants under this section, the department shall to the extent possible select applicants from all parts of the state based upon need. An amount not to exceed two percent of the fund may be used for additional staff and resources to administer the grant program in each fiscal year. Section 5. The Department of Public Safety shall submit a written report to the Legislature within sixty days after the fire department improvement grants have been made. The report shall contain the amount of each grant and the name of the recipients. Section 6. The Department of Public Safety shall promulgate rules pursuant to chapter 1-26 to specify eligibility criteria, application and award procedures and requirements, and reporting requirements to govern the awarding, use, and administration of fire department improvement grants.
